comments.body:
Sorry about this, but this thought has just now occurred to me... Should we allow to set the store suppliers individually, or just together (like `withStoreSuppliers(thisStoreSupplier, otherStoreSupplier`)?

Specifically, it seems to open the way for accidentally calling just `withStoreSupplier` and not realizing that this only sets the left side, leaving the right defaulted to a rocks store.
Or, maybe the Javadoc can just explain this. Actually, just noticed that Javadoc is missing from this class.

I'm thinking we change the name from `withStoreSupplier` to `withThisStoreSupplier` and update the KIP.  I think such a minor name change won't be controversial.   I realize I owe Javadoc for this class and I'll be sure to explain the method functions clearly.
Thanks, and the Javadoc is very clear.
Should we add a sentence that setting the name will not make the store queryable?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +166,170 @@     * or an outer join. The changelog topics will have the -changelog suffix.  The user should note that even though the join stores will have a
     * specified name, the stores will remain unavailable for querying.
     *
     * @param storeName the storeName to use
     * @return
